FuncDef:
The mep mep-id eth-bn receive enable command enables the ETH-BN receiving function in an MA.
The undo mep mep-id eth-bn receive enable command disables the ETH-BN receiving function in an MA.
By default, the ETH-BN receiving function is disabled.
CLIs: mep mep-id <mep-id> eth-bn receive enable [ min-bandwidth <min-bandwidth> ]
undo mep mep-id <mep-id> eth-bn receive enable [ min-bandwidth <min-bandwidth> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a MEP. A MEP ID identifies a MEP. The MEP ID must be unique in an MA.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8191.

Specifies the minimum bandwidth that can be advertised.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4, in Mbit/s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When routing devices connect to microwave devices, run the mep mep-id eth-bn receive enable command to enable the ETH-BN receiving function, implementing association with the microwave bandwidth.
Prerequisites
An MD, MA and MEP have been created using the cfm md, ma, and mep mep-id commands, respectively.
